DOC.brief_summary: This study develop pilot test efficacy home-based , self-administered acupressure intervention improve cancer-related fatigue ( proximal outcome ) , physical functioning quality life outcome ( distal outcome ) Chinese immigrant breast cancer survivor ( versus usual care control group ) .
DOC.detailed_description: Using Los Angeles Cancer Surveillance Program , enroll 124 foreign-born , Chinese-speaking woman Los Angeles area moderate severe level fatigue , diagnose stage 0-III breast cancer , age 21-69 , 1-5 year post-primary treatment . Using adaptive treatment strategy design , participant randomize either acupressure intervention control group . The acupressure group learn press three chief energy acupoints side body de novo 11-minute Chinese-language video practice acupressure every day ( one minute per acupoint ; total 6 minute per day ) 8-week intervention period . Participants telephone interview twice : baseline 8-weeks post-intervention follow-up .
DOC.criteria: 1 ) age 21 69 2 ) firstgeneration immigrant 3 ) speak Chinese ( Mandarin and/or Cantonese ) 4 ) diagnose breast cancer stage 0 , I , II III 5 ) complete primary treatment ( include surgery , radiation , chemotherapy ) 15 year prior recruitment 6 ) recurrence 7 ) moderate severe level fatigue . hypothyroidism anemia use acupuncture
